newsitem.title: MACAU: Portugal defence chief to meet China's Jiang.
newsitem.headline: Portugal defence chief to meet China's Jiang.

text.p: Portugal's defence minister Antonio Vitorino said on Saturday that forthcoming talks with China's President Jiang Zemin showed the importance of defence ties between the two countries.
"(It is) proof of the importance of Sino-Portuguese relations in the area of defence," Vitorino told reporters at Macau International Airport.
Vitorino is due to begin a week-long visit to China on Wednesday.
He ranks second in the Portuguese cabinet and will be the first defence minister to visit China since the two countries established diplomatic relations in 1979.
Vitorino said he and Jiang would discuss Macau's transition to Chinese rule in 1999, but would not sign any military agreements.

The Portuguese-language daily Macau Hoje said on Saturday China was keen to sell military equipment to Portugal, considering the country a gateway to European markets for modern weaponry made in China.
